byline.original: By THOMAS A. FARLEY and RUSSELL SYKES

abstract: Op-Ed article by health advocates Thomas A Farley and Russell Sykes, noting that $1.7 billion in federal food stamp dollars are spent on junk food each year, suggests ways to encourage Americans to use food stamps for healthier fare; holds government should give financial incentive for healthy food purchases or restrict use of food stamps for junk food and require that stores allocate more, and more visible, space to healthier foods.
lead_paragraph: Stores that accept food stamps should give more space to produce.

headline.main: See No Junk Food, Buy No Junk Food
headline.print_headline: See No Junk, Buy No Junk

snippet: Stores that accept food stamps should give more space to produce.
